seller_research.name: Whatfix
seller_research.description: Whatfix is an Indian SaaS-based digital adoption platform that provides in-app guidance, training, and performance support for web applications and software.

pricing_models.type: Flat fee plus user license fees
pricing_models.description: Whatfix pricing is based on two components: a flat per-application fee, plus user license fees.
pricing_models.duration: Annual billing, term length varies based on contract

pricing_models.description: Whatfix offers a free plan with 30 credits.
Whatfix offers a basic plan at $39 per month.

buyer_research.name: Grant Thornton
buyer_research.description: Grant Thornton is a multinational professional services company based in London, England. It is the world's seventh-largest by revenue and sixth-largest by number of employees professional services network of independent accounting and consulting member firms.
goals: Provide assurance, tax, and advisory services
Combine global scale and capability with local insights and understanding

pros: Offers robust governance, privacy, and security standards
Provides personalized guidance and automation to users
Helps with software adoption, user onboarding, and navigation of business applications
cons: Can be complex to implement and manage
May require significant training and support for users

pros: Offers real-time guidance and support to users
Provides analytics and insights to improve user adoption and engagement
cons: May require significant customization and integration with existing applications
differentiators: Analytics and insights to improve user adoption and engagement

competitors.name: Userpilot
pros: Offers customizable and flexible solutions for user onboarding and adoption
Provides real-time feedback and analytics to improve user experience

competitors.name: UserGuiding
pros: Offers easy-to-use and intuitive solutions for user onboarding and adoption
Provides real-time guidance and support to users

pains: Difficulty in providing high-quality services to clients due to inefficient software adoption
Inconsistent user experiences across various applications and software
Challenges in staying ahead of regulatory changes and maintaining independence and objectivity
Inefficient employee training and performance support
Difficulty in achieving business outcomes and driving user adoption
Manual efforts in user onboarding and adoption leading to decreased productivity
Lack of visibility into user behavior and performance
Limited resources and budget for digital transformation initiatives
objections: Whatfix may not be able to integrate with our existing applications and software
We are already using a digital adoption platform, why do we need Whatfix?
Whatfix may not be able to meet our specific requirements for user onboarding and adoption
We are concerned about the cost and ROI of implementing Whatfix
We are not sure if Whatfix can provide the level of customization we need
We are worried about the complexity of implementing and managing Whatfix
Whatfix may not be able to provide the level of support and training we need
We are comparing Whatfix with other solutions, how does it differentiate itself?

messages.content: Hi, I'm [Name] from Whatfix. Thank you for taking the time to speak with me today. Can you please introduce yourself and your role at Grant Thornton?
Hi, I'm [Name], a Senior Manager in the Audit and Assurance team at Grant Thornton. I'm responsible for overseeing the implementation of new technologies and processes within our organization.
Great to meet you, [Name]. Can you tell me a bit more about your current pain points and challenges when it comes to software adoption and user onboarding within your organization?

Well, we're currently struggling with inconsistent user experiences across our various applications and software. We've also noticed that our employees require significant training and support to get up to speed with new technologies, which can be time-consuming and costly.

I understand. It sounds like you're facing some common challenges that many of our clients in the professional services industry experience. Can you tell me more about your goals and objectives for improving software adoption and user onboarding within Grant Thornton?

Our goal is to provide high-quality services to our clients, and we believe that improving software adoption and user onboarding is critical to achieving that goal. We're looking for a solution that can help us accelerate digital transformation, drive user adoption, and maximize our technology investments.

That makes sense. We've helped many organizations in the professional services industry achieve those goals with our digital adoption platform. Can you tell me more about your current process for user onboarding and adoption, and how you're currently supporting your employees with software adoption?

Currently, we're relying on manual efforts to onboard and support our employees with software adoption. We have a team of trainers who provide in-person training sessions, but this can be time-consuming and doesn't always result in consistent user adoption. We're also concerned about the lack of visibility into user behavior and performance.

I understand. It sounds like you're looking for a more efficient and effective solution for user onboarding and adoption. Can you tell me more about your decision-making process for evaluating and implementing new technologies within Grant Thornton?

Our decision-making process typically involves a committee of stakeholders from various teams, including IT, audit and assurance, tax advisory, and management consulting. We also consider factors such as cost, ROI, and the level of customization and support required.
Got it. And what's the timeline for implementing a new solution for software adoption and user onboarding within Grant Thornton?
We're looking to implement a solution within the next 6-12 months. We're currently evaluating several options and want to ensure that we make the right decision for our organization.

I understand. We believe that Whatfix can provide a strong solution for Grant Thornton. We've helped many organizations in the professional services industry achieve their goals with our digital adoption platform. Can I follow up with some additional information and a demo of our solution?
Yes, that would be great. We're interested in learning more about Whatfix and how it can help us achieve our goals.

pain_points: inconsistent user experiences across various applications and software
employees require significant training and support to get up to speed with new technologies
lack of visibility into user behavior and performance

discovery_questions: Can you tell me a bit more about your current pain points and challenges when it comes to software adoption and user onboarding within your organization?
Can you tell me more about your goals and objectives for improving software adoption and user onboarding within Grant Thornton?
Can you tell me more about your current process for user onboarding and adoption, and how you're currently supporting your employees with software adoption?
decision_making_process_questions: Can you tell me more about your decision-making process for evaluating and implementing new technologies within Grant Thornton?
insights: Grant Thornton is struggling with inconsistent user experiences across various applications and software
Grant Thornton requires significant training and support to get up to speed with new technologies, which can be time-consuming and costly
Grant Thornton lacks visibility into user behavior and performance
Grant Thornton's goal is to provide high-quality services to clients, and they believe that improving software adoption and user onboarding is critical to achieving that goal
Grant Thornton is looking for a solution that can help them accelerate digital transformation, drive user adoption, and maximize their technology investments
improvements: Whatfix could provide more information about their solution's ability to address Grant Thornton's pain points and challenges
Whatfix could ask more questions about Grant Thornton's current process for user onboarding and adoption to better understand their needs
Whatfix could emphasize the benefits of their solution in terms of cost savings and ROI to address Grant Thornton's budget constraints
